meanings.definition: Lean or lie back in a relaxed position.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, she reclines on the sofa to unwind.
meanings.sent2: He often reclines in his favorite chair while watching TV.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretends to be a king as it reclines on the cushion.
meanings.sent4: The sun reclines lazily on the horizon, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The old tree reclines gracefully, its branches reaching towards the sky.

meanings.definition: To rest or relax in a horizontal position.
meanings.sent1: During the picnic, they recline on the soft grass under the shade.
meanings.sent2: The patient reclines on the hospital bed, recovering from surgery.
meanings.sent3: The dog loves to recline on the cool kitchen floor after a walk.
meanings.sent4: The riverbank gently reclines towards the water, inviting a peaceful nap.
meanings.sent5: The tired hiker finally finds a spot to recline and enjoy the mountain view.
